name: See What I Wanna See Quiz | Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: The musical was divided into two acts, each with a different story. What was the title of the first act?
questions.explanation:
R shomon.

	The Husband describes how he and his wife were coming back from watching Akira Kurosawa's "Rashomon". He remembers that the "A" was not lit on the marquee, so the title appeared as "R shomon"

questions.text: What was the title of the second act?
questions.explanation:
Gloryday.

	"Gloryday" is about a priest who has lost his faith in God. He decides to play a joke on believers and declares that Christ will rise out of a lake at 3:00 PM in a few weeeks.

questions.text: Who originated the role of The Wife?
questions.explanation:
Idina Menzel.

	Idina Menzel won a Tony Award for her role as Elphaba in "Wicked". She has also been in "Rent" and "The Wild Party", as well as "Aida". She was nominated for an award for her work with this show.

questions.text: Aaron Lohr played The Thief in the first act, but what role did he play in the second act?
questions.explanation:
A Reporter.

	Aaron Lohr was seen in the 2005 movie version of "Rent" as a member of the Life Support group, but in "See What I Wanna See" his first act role is more interesting. He plays The Thief who boldly confesses his murder of The Husband, but did he really do it?

questions.text: What murder weapon was used to kill The Husband?
questions.explanation:
A stilleto.

	The murdered Husband speaks through a psychic in Act One, "R shomon". He describes how it felt to have the knife pulled out of him, and he claims his death was a suicide.

questions.text: What illegal drug is referenced in the Act Two song "Coffee"?
questions.explanation:
Cocaine.

	"Coffee" is sung by an Actress (Idina Menzel) who has just finished shooting a coffee commercial. Shortly afterwards she is in a car crash and is seriously injured. The Actress is one of the characters who believes in the Priest's prank.

questions.text: The Priest has an aunt who is an atheist.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Aunt Monica describes God as "the greatest practical joke". She does begin to believe in God towards the end of the act, causing the Priest to question the prank that he has set in motion.

questions.text: Which actress originally played the Psychic in Act One?
questions.explanation:
Mary Testa.

	Mary Testa also played Aunt Monica in Act Two. She has also been seen on Broadway as Domina in "A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum",  in "A New Brain" Off-Broadway and in "Chicago" on Broadway.

questions.text: Complete the lyric: "Tonight I _________ my lover for the last time."
questions.explanation:
Kiss.

	This lyric is sung in the first song of both acts, "Kesa" and "Morito", respectively. In the first act, The Wife sings the song, and in the second act, The Husband sings it.

questions.text: This cast member also was an original cast member of the Broadway musical "Titanic".
questions.explanation:
Henry Stram.

	Henry Stram played George Widener and a variety of other roles in the 1997 musical "Titanic". He later replaced Allan Corduner as Henry Etches, the First Class Steward.
